rows.headline: The state’s change could alter prices for scores of people.
rows.description: California joined about a half-dozen states this month in banning the use of a person’s gender when assessing risk factors for car insurance, a change that could potentially alter rates for scores of drivers across the state.

rows.headline: Nobody was badly hurt. But with a ballooning number of older drivers in Britain, the thought of the headstrong royal behind the wheel was cause for alarm.
rows.description: LONDON — Prince Philip was at the wheel?

rows.headline: Kevin Steincross, a news anchor in St. Louis, said he misstated the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s surname in a broadcast. “This was not intentional in any way,” he said.
rows.description: Kevin Steincross, a news anchor in St. Louis, said he misstated the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s surname in a broadcast. “This was not intentional in any way,” he said.

rows.headline: It was the second time this month that an American newscaster has uttered the epithet on the air.
rows.description: A television news anchor in St. Louis apologized after he uttered a racial slur in place of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s last name during a Friday morning broadcast, nearly two weeks after another American newscaster was fired for a similar act.

rows.headline: On Friday, the health department began issuing letter grades (most of them As) to street vendors. Reactions ranged from enthusiasm to shrugs.
rows.description: One day last month, a New York City health inspector showed up at the juice cart at 54th Street and Avenue of the Americas where Long Huynh works. The inspector spent about an hour examining ingredients for freshness, and making sure the work equipment and surfaces were spotless and organized.

rows.headline: The World Anti-Doping Agency’s executive committee has scheduled a conference call for Tuesday to consider whether Russia can continue to be considered in compliance with the agency’s standards.
rows.description: Members of the ruling board of the World Anti-Doping Agency will spend the weekend considering a secret recommendation from a committee reviewing Russia’s actions in the continuing investigation into its drug-testing operations.

rows.headline: Private text messages entered as evidence in a legal dispute raise new questions about whether the artist fully designed his final works.
rows.description: In the days before the artist Robert Indiana died last May at 89, two of his close associates were brainstorming just what sort of art might be sold under the Indiana brand during his last years.

rows.headline: Mr. Van Dyke was the first Chicago police officer in decades convicted of murder for an on-duty shooting. He shot Laquan 16 times in 2014.
rows.description: CHICAGO — On a bleak stretch of road outside a Burger King four years ago, a white police officer opened fire on a black teenage boy. Captured on a dashboard camera, the killing reshaped Chicago.

rows.headline: The developer Harry Macklowe is planning a 1,551-foot-tall tower overlooking St. Patrick’s Cathedral that would join a forest of buildings that have changed New York.
rows.description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

rows.headline: The federal shutdown has brought a particular chill to Kodiak, a small town of 6,300 on an isolated island in the Gulf of Alaska.
rows.description: KODIAK, Alaska — The morning after more than 40,000 Coast Guard members missed their first paycheck, and the federal government’s shutdown stretched into its fourth week, Eleanor King placed an empty jar next to her diner’s cash register.

rows.headline: One was a military linguist. One joined the Army and served six times in Afghanistan, Iraq and Syria. One was once a member of the Navy SEALs, and one was an Arabic interpreter.
rows.description: The four Americans who were killed by a suicide bomber in Syria on Wednesday were no strangers to America’s war zones overseas.

rows.headline: The chief counsel to Gov. Philip D. Murphy hewed repeatedly on Friday to his explanation that he did not tell the governor earlier about the accusation because of confidentiality policy.
rows.description: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]

rows.headline: The explosion came amid an epidemic of fuel thefts across the country. Initial reports said dozens were killed or injured.
rows.description: A gas pipeline in the Mexican state of Hidalgo exploded on Friday night, killing at least 21 people in a blast the authorities said was caused by an illegal tap used to steal fuel.

rows.headline: The hot, dry summer of 2018 produced a sweet bumper harvest that looks like a harbinger of things to come. Traditional styles may suffer, however.
rows.description: WILTINGEN, Germany — In the bright, cavernous basement of the new Van Volxem vinery building, Christoph Dirksen, one of the Mosel region’s most important wine tasters, was making his rounds sampling from giant stainless-steel tanks.

rows.headline: The pipeline north of Mexico City exploded after thieves ruptured the line, causing an explosion that killed at least 79 people and injured 81 others.
rows.description: TLAHUELILPAN, Mexico — Mexico’s president vowed on Saturday to redouble his fight against an epidemic of fuel theft after thieves punctured a pipeline north of Mexico City, causing an explosion that killed at least 79 people and injured 81 others.

rows.headline: The events were overshadowed by divisions in the movement and allegations of anti-Semitism. Still, many women traveled to show their support.
rows.description: WASHINGTON — Whether it was stormy weather, reports of controversy or the simple waning of interest over time, the third annual Women’s March events on Saturday attracted much smaller crowds than in years past.

rows.headline: Rock music fans have emerged from the digital underground in Nigeria.
rows.description: LAGOS, Nigeria — Rock music is often produced and enjoyed under the pressure of social constraints, and the restrictive culture of post-dictatorial Nigeria made for a perfect cooker. In the 1990s and 2000s, teenagers who rejected the country’s politics of restraint in dress, physical appearance and behavior embraced American punk and metal imports.

rows.headline: The scale of the catastrophe became clear after three survivors who were rescued by the Italian Navy told aid workers 117 migrants had died in a wreck of an inflatable dinghy.
rows.description: ROME — More than 100 African migrants who set off in a rickety, inflatable dinghy have died in a wreck off the Libyan coast, humanitarian workers said on Saturday, in what was the deadliest such episode in recent months.

rows.headline: Some Democrats still blame Mr. O’Rourke for his embrace of a Texas Republican, Will Hurd, and wonder whether he can be counted on as a liberal ally.
rows.description: For a moment in August, an event hall in Texas teemed with hope, taquitos and unity.

rows.headline: Speaker John Bercow has overturned precedent to give the British Parliament a bigger role in Brexit.
rows.description: LONDON — In the wretched purgatory that was Westminster last week, there was precisely one person who seemed to be having fun.
